summary: This is a January 29, 2020 letter from defense attorneys Foy & SepLowitz LLC to the US Attorney's Office (SDNY) regarding the case US v. Tova Noel, et al. It is a discovery request for extensive information and materials related to the video surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including system failures, maintenance, footage of Epstein, and alleged misconduct by corrections officers.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking extensive discovery on the MCC video surveillance system, including its installation, maintenance, failures, and specific footage from July and August 2019.
The requests specifically seek video footage of Jeffrey Epstein, his alleged July 23 suicide attempt, and his time in custody before his death on August 10.
The indictment alleges defendants Tova Noel and Thomas falsified records by not performing inmate counts and were instead browsing the internet and appearing asleep on camera.
There were reported system failures of the MCC surveillance cameras on July 29 and August 8, 2019, with DVR-2 not recording from cameras on August 9-10.
The defense requests the identity of the MCC technician who attempted to fix the August 8 system failure and all related FBI reports on the destruction of video evidence.
